nodes.bodyText: Could you please add @NonNullByDefault to this class (sorry, I forgot to do it).
This could be replaced by a Reference parameter in the constructor.

In other bindings, you find ComponentContext as parameter of activate and deactivate methods but not as parameter of the constructor.
Is this parameter really necessary here ?
You're right.
Please make these final
This method does not existwithout parameters
What exception are you expecting here?

At least, I see that new ThingUID(args[0]) could throw IllegalArgumentException.
I don't think thingRegistry.get(thingUID) can throw any exception.
So Exception could probably be replaced by IllegalArgumentException.
In fact, I copied this pattern from my Powermax binding.
Changed to IllegalArgumentException
please call updateStatus(ThingStatus.UNKNOWN); just in case something goes horribly wrong with the login that the Thing will be in a valid state.
Are more commands expected here in the future? If not, this switch statement should be changed to an if statement.
As I implemented this part, I can answer there is no immediate plan to add other commands.
Any reason you can't use the jetty httpclient?

+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">

+  
+   <properties>
+    <bnd.importpackage>!android.*,!com.android.org.*,!dalvik.*,!javax.annotation.meta.*,!org.apache.harmony.*,!org.conscrypt.*,!sun.*</bnd.importpackage>

+      <version>1.15.0</version>
+      <scope>compile</scope>
+    </dependency>

nodes.bodyText: This was my first feedback to @clinique. So I tried myself during several days to use Jetty HTTP client and it was a real nightmare. I never succeeded. I tried a lot of things, even adding certificates to my JVM key store. And I have a certain experience with that as I alreadyt handled it with success in the Freebox binding.

nodes.bodyText: I agree.
Please use StringBuilder instead of string concatenation to build up this value.
Surely there is a way to implement this without recursion right?
I would keep recursion also.
You need to add license information for the okhttp and okio dependencies.

nodes.bodyText: Instead of -1, use Double.NaN to represent the the absence of data. This makes the code look safer as well as using an already existing definition for bad data.

Minor correction.

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    updateState(channelId, consumption != Double.NaN ? new QuantityType<>(consumption, SmartHomeUnits.KILOWATT_HOUR)
          
          
            
                    updateState(channelId, !Double.isNaN(consumption) ? new QuantityType<>(consumption, SmartHomeUnits.KILOWATT_HOUR)
Should this also update the ThingStatus?
Since Response implements Closable please wrap this in a try-with-resources.

From what I can tell, the only caller of this method splits apart the returned string into each line. Why can't this method just return a List<String>? Seems kinda strange to add in a bunch of newline characters only for callers of the method to immediately remove them.
It would be more efficient to pass in the List as a parameter so it can be used on recursive calls.
WDYT?
I agree that it is a good remark.
This can be omitted since try-with-resources handles this for you.
missed this one?
Yes, sh**t !
This can be omitted since try-with-resources handles this for you.
Perhaps you should have an else statement here that prints usage as well?
There is one in line 107

Most builder designs return the same object, so I don't think you should use a builder as a static field and instead should construct it each time. Does LOGIN_BODY_BUILDER return a new builder instance each time you mutate it? If not then LOGIN_BODY_BUILDER should instead be a static method, named appropriately of course.
